availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Napoleon Jackson Tecumseh Dana (Ramsey County, Minnesota, banker and U.S. Army major general)

body.p: Ramsey County, Minnesota, banker and U.S. Army major general. Maine native. Married to Susan Lewis Sandford Dana on June 11, 1844. Father of Mary S. Dana, Charles P. Dana, and Alfred S. Dana. Graduate of West Point Military Academy in 1842. Served as an officer in the 7th U.S. Infantry during the Mexican-American War. U.S. Army officer at Fort Gaines, Mahkato, Minnesota Territory, in 1850. Banker in St. Paul, Minnesota, in 1860. Served in the 1st Minnesota Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel and brigadier general from October 2, 1861, to September 17, 1862. Promoted to major general of U.S. Volunteers on November 29, 1862. Commanded the 13th U.S. Army Corps from October 25, 1863, to April 3, 1864. Commanded the District of Vicksburg, Army of the Tennessee, from August 19, 1864, to November 28, 1864. In command of the Department of Mississippi from November 28, 1864, to May 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Minnesota, Fort Gaines, Mahkota, p. 17B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Minnesota, Ramsey County, Saint Paul, 1st Ward, p. 84.
Ezra J. Warner, Jr., Generals in Blue: Lives of the Union Commanders (Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 1964), 111-12.
John H. Eicher & David J. Eicher, eds., Civil War High Commands (Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2001), 198-99.
Find A Grave, "MG Napoleon Jackson Tecumseh Dana (1822-1905)," Memorial #20150, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20150 (accessed December 21, 2020).
